info.title: Astrology API v3
info.description:
# üåü Astrology API v3.2.10 - Professional Astrological Service

**Modern astrological calculations powered by Swiss Ephemeris with comprehensive interpretations and analysis tools.**

## üîë **Get Your API Key First!**
**üëâ [Grab your API key at the Developer Dashboard](https://dashboard.astrology-api.io/)** - you'll need it to make requests (it's quick and easy!)

## üöÄ **Core Features**
- **High-precision calculations** - Swiss Ephemeris accuracy with 23 house systems
- **Traditional astrology** - Hellenistic techniques, dignities, profections, lots
- **Comprehensive reports** - Natal charts, synastry, transits with detailed interpretations
- **Business insights** - Team dynamics, compatibility analysis, career guidance
- **Pet astrology** - Animal personality and care insights
- **Multiple languages** - Support for EN, RU, FR, DE, ES and more
- **Fast performance** - 50-500ms response times with intelligent caching

## üì± **Perfect for**
Professional astrologers, mobile apps, educational platforms, research projects, and business consulting tools.

## üìö **Documentation**
- **[üöÄ RapiDoc](/rapidoc)** - Interactive documentation with live examples
- **[üì• Postman Collection](/best-astrology-api-postman.json)** - 113 ready-to-use examples
- **[‚ùì FAQ & Help](/docs/faq)** - Troubleshooting and implementation guides

**üåü Quick start: `/api/v3/glossary/active-points`**

get.description: Gets astrological data for the current UTC time.

200.description: Current UTC time data for immediate astrological calculations

post.description:
üìä **Planetary Positions Calculator** - Get precise celestial body positions

**Perfect for:**
- üéØ Quick planetary position lookups
- üì± Mobile app backends requiring fast data
- üîÑ Real-time astrological applications
- üìä Data analysis and research

**What you get:**
- **Precise positions** for all requested celestial bodies
- **Zodiac signs** (3-letter codes: Ari, Tau, Gem, etc.)
- **Degrees within signs** (0.0 to 29.99)
- **Absolute longitude** (0-360¬∞ full zodiac position)
- **Retrograde status** for all planets
- **Planetary speed** (degrees per day)

**Supported celestial bodies:**
- **Planets**: Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto
- **Lunar Nodes**: Mean_Node, True_Node, Mean_South_Node, True_South_Node
- **Angles**: Ascendant, Medium_Coeli, Descendant, Imum_Coeli
- **Points**: Mean_Lilith, True_Lilith, Pars_Fortunae, Vertex
- **Asteroids**: Chiron, Ceres, Pallas, Juno, Vesta

**Location handling:**
- Provide city + country_code for automatic geocoding
- Or use exact latitude/longitude coordinates
- Timezone automatically detected or specify manually

**Response time:** ~100ms | **Accuracy:** Swiss Ephemeris precision
- ‚úÖ **City geocoding** - just provide city name, we handle coordinates & timezone

Perfect for applications needing precise astronomical data without interpretations.

**New feature:**
- üÜï `filter_retrograde_only`: When true, returns only planets currently in retrograde

post.description:
üåç **Global Planetary Positions** - Location-independent ephemeris data

**Perfect for:**
- üìä Daily ephemeris table generation
- üóÑÔ∏è Caching planetary positions for multiple locations
- üì± Astrology apps requiring global reference data
- üîÑ Background data synchronization

**What you get:**
- **Precise positions** for all requested celestial bodies
- **Zodiac signs** (3-letter codes: Ari, Tau, Gem, etc.)
- **Degrees within signs** (0.0 to 29.99)
- **Absolute longitude** (0-360¬∞ full zodiac position)
- **Retrograde status** for all planets
- **Planetary speed** (degrees per day)

**Key features:**
- **No location required** - uses universal reference (0¬∞N, 0¬∞W)
- **Both zodiac types** - Tropical and Sidereal calculations
- **Flexible precision** - 0-8 decimal places
- **Extensive body support** - planets, asteroids, nodes, special points

**Excluded points:** Location-dependent angles (Ascendant, MC, Vertex) are not included
since no birth location is provided.

**Use case:** Cache these positions once per day, then calculate house placements
locally for different birth locations to optimize API usage.

**Response time:** ~80ms | **Accuracy:** Swiss Ephemeris precision

post.description:
üèõÔ∏è **Enhanced Aspects with Reception Analysis (v3.2.0)**

Returns aspects enriched with traditional reception analysis:

**Traditional Enhancements:**
- ‚úÖ **Reception Quality**: Mutual and single receptions between planets
- ‚úÖ **Dignity Context**: Both planets' dignity status in aspects
- ‚úÖ **Aspect Strength**: Weighted by planetary dignities and orbs
- ‚úÖ **Aspect Nature**: benefic, mildly_malefic, malefic, neutral

**Reception Types:**
- **mutual_pure**: Both planets receive each other by the SAME dignity type (e.g., both by domicile)
- **mutual_mixed**: Both planets receive each other by DIFFERENT dignity types (e.g., domicile + exaltation)
- **single**: Only one planet receives the other
- **Reception by Dignity**: Domicile, exaltation, triplicity, term, decan

**Aspect Nature Classification:**
- **benefic**: Benefic aspects (trine, sextile) or benefic planets
- **mildly_malefic**: Malefic conjunct luminary WITH reception (mitigated)
- **malefic**: Malefic hard aspects to luminaries, or malefic conjunct luminary WITHOUT reception
- **neutral**: Other aspects not clearly benefic or malefic

**Mutual Receptions List:**
- Includes `is_pure` field (true = mutual_pure, false = mutual_mixed)
- Quality rating: excellent, strong, moderate, weak

**Aspect Strength Calculation:**
- Orb tightness (closer = stronger)
- Planetary dignity status
- Reception quality bonus
- Traditional aspect hierarchy

**Perfect for:**
- Traditional aspect interpretation
- Reception-based counseling
- Advanced astrological analysis
- Educational applications

post.description:
üí¨ **Synastry: Dialogue Between Two Charts** - How two people influence each other

**What this is:**
Comparison of two **separate** natal charts. Shows how one person's planets
interact with another person's planets (cross-aspects).
Answers the question: **"How do WE affect each other?"**

**vs /composite:** Use `/composite` to see the relationship as a separate entity ("What is our relationship's destiny?")

**Perfect for:**
- üíë Relationship compatibility ‚Äî who triggers what in whom
- üë• Business partnerships ‚Äî working dynamics
- üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Family dynamics ‚Äî parent-child, sibling relationships
- ü§ù Friendship compatibility

**What you get:**
- **Cross-aspects** between both charts (`Sun_1` ‚Üî `Moon_2`, `Venus_1` ‚Üî `Mars_2`)
- **Planetary overlays** ‚Äî which houses person B's planets activate in person A's chart
- **Aspect orbs and types** ‚Äî conjunction, trine, square, opposition, sextile
- **Both charts preserved** ‚Äî each person remains a separate entity

**Example cross-aspects:**
- `Venus_1 conjunction Mars_2` ‚Üí sexual attraction from person 1 to person 2
- `Moon_1 square Saturn_2` ‚Üí emotional coldness from person 2
- `Sun_1 trine Moon_2` ‚Üí natural harmony and understanding

**Metaphor:** Two people having a conversation ‚Äî each remains themselves, but influences the other.

**Response time:** ~300ms | **Accuracy:** Professional relationship analysis

romantic_compatibility.description: Love relationship analysis between partners from different countries

business_partnership.description: Professional compatibility using coordinates and extended points

karmic_connection.description: Soul connection focus with nodes, Lilith, and spiritual points

200.description: Successful synastry chart calculation with cross-aspects between both people's charts

successful_response.description: Complete chart data with all requested calculations

post.description:
üë∂ **Composite: The Third Entity** - The relationship itself as a separate chart

**What this is:**
Creates a **new chart** from mathematical midpoints between both people's planets.
This is the chart of the relationship itself ‚Äî a "third entity" born from two people.
Answers the question: **"What is OUR RELATIONSHIP's destiny?"**

**vs /synastry:** Use `/synastry` to see how two people influence each other ("How do we interact?")

**Perfect for:**
- üíë Understanding relationship potential and destiny
- üéØ Couples counseling ‚Äî what the relationship needs
- üìÖ Transits to composite ‚Äî timing for the relationship
- üì± Dating apps ‚Äî relationship compatibility score

**How it works:**
- `Composite Sun` = (Sun_Alice + Sun_Bob) / 2
- `Composite Moon` = (Moon_Alice + Moon_Bob) / 2
- Creates ONE unified chart representing combined energies

**What you get:**
- **Composite planetary positions** ‚Äî midpoints of corresponding planets
- **Composite houses** ‚Äî where the relationship energy manifests
- **Internal aspects** ‚Äî aspects within the composite (Sun-Moon, Venus-Mars, etc.)
- **Single unified chart** ‚Äî NOT two separate charts

**Example interpretation:**
- Composite Sun in 7th house ‚Üí relationship focused on partnership
- Composite Moon square Saturn ‚Üí emotional challenges in the relationship
- Composite Venus conjunct Jupiter ‚Üí abundant love and growth together

**Metaphor:** Two people create a "child" ‚Äî the relationship itself, which has its own chart and destiny.

**Response time:** ~400ms | **Content:** Complete composite chart with planetary positions and aspects

basic_composite.description: Calculate composite chart for two people using default options

advanced_composite.description: Composite chart with custom house system and extended planetary points

200.description: Successful composite chart calculation with midpoint-based planetary positions representing the relationship

successful_response.description: Complete chart data with all requested calculations

post.description:
üì∏ **Transit Snapshot** - Planetary positions at a specific moment

**What this is:**
A "photograph" of the sky at a **specific date/time** overlaid on the natal chart.
Answers the question: **"What's happening in my chart RIGHT NOW?"**

**Input:** Natal data + exact transit datetime (e.g., "March 15, 2024 at 12:00")

**vs /natal-transits:** Use `/natal-transits` for period analysis ("What transits await me in March?")

**Perfect for:**
- üéØ Daily astrological guidance ‚Äî current sky snapshot
- üìÖ Checking transits for a specific moment
- üîÆ Understanding "what's happening now"
- üì± Transit wheel visualizations

**What you get:**
- **Transit positions** (`Sun_transit`, `Moon_transit`, etc.) overlaid on natal chart
- **Natal positions** (`Sun_natal`, `Moon_natal`, etc.) for reference
- **Active aspects** between transiting and natal planets at this moment
- **House overlays** showing which houses transits are activating
- **Aspect orbs** ‚Äî how close to exact each aspect is

**Analysis includes:**
- **Major transits** (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto)
- **Personal transits** (Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars)
- **Nodal transits** for karmic timing
- **Angular transits** (to Ascendant, Midheaven)

**Response time:** ~250ms | **Accuracy:** Swiss Ephemeris precision

üé® **Render Natal Chart** - Generate visual birth chart in multiple formats

**Output Formats:**
- `svg` - Scalable vector (default) - best for web, infinite scaling
- `png` - Raster with transparency - universal compatibility
- `jpg` - Compressed raster - email-compatible (works in Outlook!)
- `webp` - Modern format - 30% smaller than PNG
- `pdf` - Print-ready vector - professional quality

**Size Options:**
- `width` - Output width in pixels (100-4096), height auto-calculated
- `scale` - Resolution multiplier (0.5-4.0) for HiDPI/retina displays

**Quality:**
- `quality` - For jpg/webp formats (1-100), default 90

**üé® Custom Colors (NEW!):**
Create branded charts with your own color scheme:
- `background` - Chart background color
- `text` - Text and lines color
- `primary` / `secondary` - Accent colors
- `aspect_harmony` - Harmonious aspects (green)
- `aspect_tension` - Tense aspects (red)
- `zodiac_bg_0` / `zodiac_bg_1` - Alternating zodiac sector colors

**Use Cases:**
- üìß Email reports ‚Üí `jpg` or `png` (Outlook compatible)
- üåê Web display ‚Üí `svg` or `webp`
- üì± Social media ‚Üí `jpg` with width=1080
- üñ®Ô∏è Print ‚Üí `pdf` with scale=2.0
- üì± Retina ‚Üí `png` with scale=2.0
- üé® White-label ‚Üí `custom_colors` for brand consistency

**Response time:** ~400-600ms depending on format

interpretations.title: Sun in Tau
interpretations.text: With the Sun in Taurus, you possess a natural stability and determination that serves as your core foundation. You approach life with patience and practicality, preferring to build slowly and steadily toward your goals. Your Taurus Sun gives you a deep appreciation for beauty, comfort, and the finer things in life, while your reliable nature makes you someone others can count on through both good times and challenges.

interpretations.title: Moon in Sco
interpretations.text: Your Moon in Scorpio reveals intense emotional depths and a powerful intuitive nature. You feel everything deeply and have a natural ability to understand the hidden motivations and psychological undercurrents in any situation. This placement gives you emotional resilience and the ability to transform through life's challenges, though you may tend to keep your most vulnerable feelings private.

interpretations.title: Mercury in Gem
interpretations.text: Mercury in Gemini blesses you with a quick, versatile mind that thrives on variety and intellectual stimulation. You're naturally curious about everything and have a gift for communication, easily adapting your conversational style to connect with different people. Your mental agility allows you to process information rapidly and see multiple perspectives on any issue.

interpretations.title: Venus in Ari
interpretations.text: Venus in Aries brings passion and spontaneity to your approach to love and relationships. You're drawn to exciting, dynamic partners and prefer direct, honest expressions of affection. In love, you can be both passionate and impatient, often falling quickly but also expecting immediate reciprocation of your feelings.

interpretations.title: Mars in Aqu
interpretations.text: Mars in Aquarius drives you to fight for causes greater than yourself and pursue your goals in unconventional ways. You're motivated by ideals of progress, equality, and innovation, and you prefer to take action as part of a group rather than going it alone. Your approach to conflict is often detached and intellectual rather than purely emotional.

interpretations.title: Sun in House_10
interpretations.text: With your Sun in the 10th house, your life's purpose is closely tied to your career and public reputation. You have natural leadership abilities and a strong drive to achieve recognition and success in your chosen field. Your identity is significantly shaped by your professional accomplishments and the respect you earn from others.

interpretations.title: Moon in House_4
interpretations.text: Your Moon in the 4th house emphasizes the importance of home, family, and emotional security in your life. You have strong ties to your roots and may be particularly influenced by your mother or family heritage. Creating a safe, nurturing home environment is essential for your emotional well-being.

interpretations.title: Sun_opposition_Moon
interpretations.text: The opposition between your Sun and Moon creates internal tension between your conscious goals and emotional needs. You may often feel torn between what you want to achieve and what you need for emotional fulfillment. Learning to integrate these opposing forces will be a key theme in your personal development.

interpretations.title: Sun_trine_Jupiter
interpretations.text: The trine between your Sun and Jupiter brings optimism, good fortune, and expansion opportunities into your life. You naturally attract positive experiences and have faith in your ability to succeed. This aspect supports growth, wisdom, and a generous spirit that others find inspirational.

interpretations.title: Venus_square_Saturn
interpretations.text: The square between Venus and Saturn may create challenges in love and relationships, often manifesting as feelings of unworthiness or difficulty expressing affection. However, this aspect also teaches valuable lessons about commitment, loyalty, and the importance of building relationships on solid foundations rather than fleeting attractions.

interpretations.title: Waxing Crescent Phase
interpretations.text: The Waxing Crescent phase represents a time of intention setting and taking initial action toward your goals. This is an ideal time for planning new projects, making decisions, and building momentum. The energy is growing and optimistic, encouraging you to move forward with confidence while remaining flexible in your approach.

interpretations.title: Moon in Leo
interpretations.text: With the Moon currently in Leo, emotions run dramatic and expressive. This is a time when creativity, self-expression, and personal recognition become especially important. You may feel more confident, generous, and eager to share your talents with others. Romance and artistic pursuits are favored under this placement.

interpretations.title: Lunar Day 6 Energy
interpretations.text: The 6th lunar day brings energy focused on service, healing, and practical improvements. This is an excellent time for addressing health matters, organizing your environment, and helping others. The energy supports methodical work and attention to detail, making it ideal for tasks that require precision and care.

interpretations.title: 28% Illumination Impact
interpretations.text: At 28% illumination, the Moon's influence is moderate but growing. This level of lunar energy supports new beginnings while maintaining enough introspective quality for thoughtful planning. It's an excellent balance for both action and reflection, allowing you to move forward with confidence while staying connected to your inner wisdom.

interpretations.title: Distance and Emotional Intensity
interpretations.text: At a standard orbital distance of 384,400 km, the Moon's emotional influence is at typical intensity. You may experience emotions in a balanced way - neither overwhelmingly intense nor unusually detached. This neutral lunar distance supports steady emotional progress and clear decision-making abilities.

interpretations.title: Optimal Timing Guidance
interpretations.text: This lunar configuration is excellent for creative projects, romantic endeavors, and public presentations. The Leo Moon encourages bold self-expression, while the Waxing Crescent phase supports new initiatives. Avoid major emotional decisions late in the evening when Leo's dramatic tendencies might be amplified.

interpretations.title: Solar Return Overview - Year Ahead
interpretations.text: This solar return year emphasizes expansion, learning, and new horizons. With the return Sun in the 9th house, this is a year for broadening your perspective through travel, education, or philosophical exploration. Expect opportunities for growth that take you beyond your comfort zone and expand your understanding of the world.

interpretations.title: Moon in 1st House - Emotional Focus
interpretations.text: The Solar Return Moon in your 1st house indicates a year of emotional renewal and personal transformation. Your feelings and intuition will play a major role in the decisions you make this year. This placement suggests increased emotional sensitivity and a need to honor your authentic feelings as you navigate the year ahead.

interpretations.title: Mercury in 8th House - Deep Investigation
interpretations.text: Mercury in the 8th house of your Solar Return chart suggests a year of researching, investigating, and uncovering hidden truths. Your mental focus turns to subjects that require depth and intensity - psychology, finances, shared resources, or transformational healing. Expect important communications related to joint finances or intimate partnerships.

interpretations.title: Venus in 9th House - Love Through Learning
interpretations.text: Venus joining the Sun in the 9th house brings romance and beauty into your educational and travel experiences. You may meet someone special while traveling or studying, or find that relationships are enhanced through shared philosophical or cultural interests. Artistic inspiration comes from foreign sources or higher learning.

interpretations.title: Mars in 7th House - Relationship Dynamics
interpretations.text: Mars in the 7th house of partnerships indicates an active and potentially challenging year in relationships. You may be more assertive with partners or attract more dynamic individuals into your life. This placement can bring energy and passion to partnerships but requires conscious effort to avoid conflicts or power struggles.

interpretations.title: Key Themes for the Year
interpretations.text: The dominant theme is expansion through learning and relationships. The 9th house emphasis encourages you to think bigger, travel more, and embrace new philosophies. The 7th house Mars suggests that partnerships will be a catalyst for growth, though they may also present challenges that help you develop better negotiation skills and personal boundaries.

interpretations.title: Timing and Seasonal Influences
interpretations.text: The strongest manifestations of these themes will likely occur during Taurus season (late April - May) when transiting planets activate your Solar Return Sun position. Pay special attention to developments around the autumn equinox when the Sun opposes your return position, potentially bringing relationship or educational matters to a head.

üèõÔ∏è **Calculate Annual Profection (Lord of the Year)**

Returns the activated house, sign, and planetary ruler for any given age using traditional
Hellenistic methods. Essential for traditional timing techniques.

**Traditional Method:**
- Each year of life activates a different house (age mod 12)
- The ruler of the activated sign becomes the "Lord of the Year" (Chronocrator)
- Provides insights into the year's main themes and planetary influences

**Example:** At age 25, the 2nd house is activated (25 mod 12 = 1, +1 = 2nd house).
If Ascendant is Aries, the activated sign is Taurus, ruled by Venus.

**Use Cases:**
- Annual planning and timing
- Understanding yearly themes
- Traditional predictive astrology
- Life cycle analysis

domicile.name: Domicile
domicile.description: Planet in its own sign - strongest essential dignity
domicile.analogy: Planet at home, in full control of resources
domicile.effect: Planet expresses its nature most purely and powerfully

exaltation.name: Exaltation
exaltation.description: Planet in its exaltation sign - second strongest dignity
exaltation.analogy: Planet honored as guest, given special status
exaltation.effect: Planet performs at its highest potential, elevated expression

triplicity.name: Triplicity
triplicity.analogy: Planet comfortable in familiar elemental environment
triplicity.effect: Planet operates harmoniously within elemental context

term.name: Term/Bounds
term.analogy: Planet has limited authority in specific degree ranges
term.calculation: Each sign divided into 5 unequal segments ruled by different planets
term.effect: Moderate dignity, planet has some authority but limited scope

decan.name: Decan/Face
decan.analogy: Planet has minimal authority, like a messenger or representative
decan.order: Mars, Sun, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Saturn, Jupiter (repeating)
decan.calculation: Each sign has three 10¬∞ decans following Chaldean planetary order
decan.effect: Weakest dignity, provides subtle influence and coloration

exile.name: Exile/Detriment
exile.description: Planet in sign opposite its domicile
exile.analogy: Planet banished from home, operating in hostile territory
exile.effect: Significantly weakened, contrary to planetary nature, struggles to function

fall.name: Fall
fall.description: Planet in sign opposite its exaltation
fall.analogy: Planet fallen from grace, unable to achieve highest potential
fall.effect: Weakened expression, difficulty accessing highest potentials

get.description:
üìö **Horary Considerations Reference** - The 8 traditional tests of chart radicality

**Perfect for:**
- üéì Learning traditional horary astrology
- üîç Understanding chart radicality (fitness for judgment)
- üìñ Reference for William Lilly's considerations before judgment
- üéØ Educational applications and horary study

**What you get:**
- **All 8 Considerations** - Complete list with traditional meanings
- **Thresholds** - Exact criteria for each consideration
- **Severity Levels** - Importance weighting (low/medium/high)
- **Practical Descriptions** - Clear explanations of each consideration
- **Historical Context** - Based on William Lilly's "Christian Astrology"

**The 8 Considerations:**
1. **Early Ascendant** (< 3¬∞) - Question premature, not fully understood
2. **Late Ascendant** (> 27¬∞) - Question too late, outcome decided
3. **Moon Void of Course** - Nothing will come of the matter
4. **Saturn in 1st House** - Querent fear or anxiety
5. **Saturn in 7th House** - Astrologer uncertainty
6. **Moon in Via Combusta** - Unfortunate outcomes
7. **Ascendant in Via Combusta** - Chart difficult to judge
8. **Lord of Ascendant Combust** - Querent's judgment clouded

**Usage:**
Use this endpoint to understand what makes a horary chart "radical" (fit to be judged).
Charts with multiple considerations present should be judged with extra caution or not at all.

**Response time:** < 10ms | **Content:** Complete considerations reference data

get.description:
üéØ **Horary Question Categories Reference** - Complete guide to matters and questions

**Traditional Terminology:**
- **category** = "Matter" (lat. *materia*) ‚Äî the subject matter of the question
- **subcategory** = "Question" (lat. *quaestio*) ‚Äî the specific question being asked

Based on William Lilly's "Christian Astrology" chapter organization by house matters.

**Perfect for:**
- üéì Learning traditional horary significator rules
- üîç Understanding which planets/houses represent what
- üìñ Reference for William Lilly's house-to-matter correspondences
- üéØ Educational applications and horary study
- üèóÔ∏è Building horary chart interpretation interfaces

**What you get:**
- **All 11 Question Categories (Matters)** - Complete significator mappings
- **Subcategories (Questions)** - Specific question types within each matter
- **House Assignments** - Which houses govern each matter
- **Natural Significators** - Planets with inherent meaning for each topic
- **Detailed Explanations** - Traditional reasoning behind each assignment
- **Lord Notation** - Understanding L1, L5, L7, L10 etc. (house lords)

**Understanding Significators:**
In horary astrology, significators are the planets that represent the people,
things, or matters involved in the question. There are two types:

1. **House Lords (L1, L5, L7, etc.)** - The planet ruling the sign on a house cusp
   - L1 = Lord of Ascendant (querent, the person asking)
   - L5 = Lord of 5th House (children, pregnancy, creativity)
   - L7 = Lord of 7th House (partners, relationships, opponents)
   - L10 = Lord of 10th House (career, reputation, authority)

2. **Natural Significators** - Planets with inherent meaning
   - Moon: Fertility, body, emotions, change
   - Venus: Love, beauty, harmony, desire
   - Jupiter: Growth, expansion, wealth, success
   - Sun: Authority, vitality, success, recognition

**Question Categories:**
- **Pregnancy/Fertility** - 5th house, Moon, Jupiter
- **Love** - 7th house, Venus
- **Marriage** - 7th house, Venus
- **Career** - 10th house, Sun
- **Job** - 6th house
- **Money** - 2nd house, Jupiter
- **Health** - 6th house, Moon
- **Missing Item** - 2nd & 4th houses, Moon
- **Travel** - 9th house, Jupiter
- **General** - 1st house, Moon

**Traditional Rulerships (Used for House Lords):**
- Aries & Scorpio: Mars
- Taurus & Libra: Venus
- Gemini & Virgo: Mercury
- Cancer: Moon
- Leo: Sun
- Sagittarius & Pisces: Jupiter
- Capricorn & Aquarius: Saturn

Note: Horary uses traditional (pre-modern) rulerships only.
No Uranus, Neptune, or Pluto.

**Response time:** < 10ms | **Content:** Complete significator reference for all categories

üîÆ **Generate Horary Chart**

Calculate a complete horary chart for the moment a question was understood by the astrologer.
Uses Regiomontanus house system (traditional for horary) and includes full dignity analysis
and Arabic Parts.

**Perfect for:**
- üéØ Question-based divination and prediction
- üìö Traditional horary astrology practice
- üéì Learning horary techniques
- üì± Building horary astrology applications

**What you get:**
- **Complete Chart Data** - Planetary positions, houses, aspects with Regiomontanus houses
- **Essential Dignities** - Full dignity analysis for all planets (domicile, exaltation, etc.)
- **Arabic Parts** - Part of Fortune and other relevant lots
- **Horary-specific Calculations** - Ready for radicality checking and judgment

**Traditional Method:**
- Chart is cast for the exact moment the astrologer understood the question
- Regiomontanus houses are used (traditional standard for horary)
- Time accuracy is critical - use the precise moment of question comprehension
- Location should be where the astrologer is located when understanding the question

**House Systems:**
- Default: Regiomontanus ('R') - traditional horary standard
- Alternative: Placidus ('P'), Whole Sign ('W'), Koch ('K'), Equal ('A')
- Note: Most traditional horary texts use Regiomontanus

**Use Cases:**
- Yes/no questions about concrete outcomes
- Timing predictions ("When will X happen?")
- Missing item recovery ("Where is my lost ring?")
- Relationship questions ("Will we get married?")
- Career and financial questions
- Health inquiries

  - ‚ö†Ô∏è **Note**: May be empty if Moon is Void of Course (VOC) - when Moon makes no more aspects before leaving its sign, traditional horary cannot reliably predict timing
- **Radicality Check** - Chart fitness for judgment
- **Comprehensive Interpretation** - Plain language analysis and recommendations

**Traditional Method:**
Based on William Lilly's "Christian Astrology" and classical horary techniques:
- **Moon** (35% weight) - Primary fertility significator
- **5th House** (25% weight) - House of children and procreation
- **5th House Ruler** (20% weight) - Condition shows potential
- **Jupiter** (15% weight) - Natural significator of growth/expansion
- **Ascendant** (5% weight) - Querent's overall condition

**Sign Fertility Classifications:**
- **Fruitful Signs** (Cancer, Scorpio, Pisces) - Water signs, highly supportive
- **Semi-fruitful Signs** (Taurus, Sagittarius) - Moderately supportive
- **Barren Signs** (Aries, Gemini, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Capricorn, Aquarius) - Less favorable

**Scoring Guide:**
- **70-100**: Favorable - Strong fertility indicators
- **55-69**: Mixed - Some positive, some challenging factors
- **40-54**: Mixed - Balanced factors
- **0-39**: Challenging - Significant obstacles or delays

**Customer Priority Feature**: This endpoint provides specialized fertility analysis
combining traditional horary techniques with modern astrological practice.

**Response time:** ~200ms | **Content:** Complete fertility analysis with timing and interpretation

post.description:
üîÆ **Complete Horary Analysis with Judgment**

Returns full horary analysis including radicality check, significator identification,
aspect perfection analysis, reception, and final judgment (yes/no/unclear).

**Traditional Terminology:**
- **category** = "Matter" (lat. *materia*) ‚Äî the subject matter of the question
- **subcategory** = "Question" (lat. *quaestio*) ‚Äî the specific question being asked

**Perfect for:**
- üéØ Yes/no question divination
- üìä Traditional horary astrology practice
- üîç Detailed analysis with reasoning
- ‚è±Ô∏è Optional timing predictions
- üìö Learning traditional techniques

**What you get:**
- **Radicality Check** - Chart fitness for judgment (8 traditional considerations)
- **Significator Identification** - Querent, quesited, and additional planets
- **Aspect Perfection** - Applying vs separating aspects between significators
- **Lunar Analysis** - Moon's aspects as co-significator with degrees_to_perfection
- **Secondary Perfection** - Translation, Collection of Light, Prohibition, Frustration
- **Reception Analysis** - Mutual reception and dispositorship
- **Final Judgment** - Yes/No/Unclear with confidence score and detailed reasoning
- **Timing Predictions** - Optional timing estimates based on perfecting aspects

**Note:** For comprehensive planetary aspects (all 21 planet pairs), use `/api/v3/data/aspects`
with the same chart time. This endpoint focuses on traditional horary testimonies.

**Question Categories (required):**
See `GET /api/v3/horary/glossary/categories` for complete list with subcategories.

Main categories: pregnancy, fertility, love, marriage, career, job, money, health, missing_item, travel, general

**Traditional Methods:**
- William Lilly's "Christian Astrology" principles
- Aspect perfection as primary testimony
- Reception strengthens weak aspects
- Translation and collection of light
- Prohibition and frustration checks

**Response time:** ~500-800ms | **Content:** Comprehensive analysis with judgment and reasoning

get.description:
**Horary Question Categories** - Reference for question types and subtypes

Returns all horary question categories and their subtypes for use with
`/horary/analyze` endpoint. Each category has specific subtypes with
different judgment criteria and significators.

**Perfect for:**
- Discovering available question categories
- Understanding subtype-specific significators
- Building dynamic question forms
- Educational horary content

**What you get:**
- **Categories** - Main question types (health, love, career, etc.)
- **Subtypes** - Specific question variations within each category
- **Significators** - Planets/points to examine for each subtype
- **Descriptions** - Human-readable question examples

**Example usage with /horary/analyze:**
```json
{
    "question": "Will I get the job?",
    "category": "career",
    "subtype": "get_position",
    ...
}
```

**Response time:** ~10ms | **Content:** Complete horary category reference

post.description:
üåå **Davison Relationship Chart** - The midpoint chart of your relationship

**What is it?**
The Davison chart calculates the exact midpoint in time and space between
two births, creating a chart for the relationship itself as a separate entity.

**Calculation:**
- Midpoint in space (latitude/longitude average)
- Midpoint in time (between two birth moments)
- Creates a third chart representing the relationship

**Use cases:**
- Understanding the relationship's purpose
- Timing for the relationship
- Relationship's personality

**Response time:** ~400ms

**Perfect for:**

- üì± Travel planning applications

**What you get:**

- **World map** - Accurate geographic projection with country boundaries
- **Power zones** - Highlighted intersections of planetary lines
- **City markers** - Major cities with population filtering
- **Interactive data** - Coordinates and meanings for frontend integration
- **Customizable** - Size, colors, projection, and styling options

**Line Types:**
- **AC (Ascendant)** - Where planet rises on eastern horizon
- **MC (Midheaven)** - Where planet culminates overhead
- **DS (Descendant)** - Where planet sets on western horizon
- **IC (Imum Coeli)** - Where planet is at lowest point

**Supported Planets:**
Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto,
Mean_Node, True_Node, Chiron

**Map Projections:**
- **Mercator** - Standard web mapping (default)
- **Robinson** - Balanced world view
- **Mollweide** - Equal-area projection
- **Equirectangular** - Simple latitude/longitude grid

**Languages:** 16 base languages + regional variants (en, ru, de, fr, es, it, pt, tr, ar, hi, zh, uk, ja, ko, nl, pl, pt-BR, zh-CN, etc.)
Set `visual_options.language` to localize legends, labels, and interpretations.

üó∫Ô∏è **Render Astrocartography Map** - Multi-format map generation

**Output Formats:**
- `svg` - Scalable vector (default) - best for web, interactive features
- `png` - Raster with transparency - email reports (Outlook compatible!)
- `jpg` - Compressed raster - social media sharing
- `webp` - Modern format - 30% smaller than PNG
- `pdf` - Print-ready vector - professional consultations

**Size Options:**
- `width` - Output width in pixels (100-4096)
- `scale` - Resolution multiplier for HiDPI displays

**üé® Custom Colors:**
Override default theme colors for branded maps:
- `background`, `text`, `primary`, `secondary`
- `aspect_harmony`, `aspect_tension`

**Use Cases:**
- üìß Email reports ‚Üí `png` or `jpg` (Outlook compatible)
- üåê Web display ‚Üí `svg` (interactive, scalable)
- üì± Social media ‚Üí `jpg` with width=1200
- üñ®Ô∏è Print ‚Üí `pdf` with scale=2.0
- üé® White-label ‚Üí `custom_colors` for brand consistency

**Response time:** ~800-1200ms depending on format and complexity

lines.meaning: The Sun Ascendant line represents where solar energy rises on the eastern horizon. Living near this line enhances leadership qualities, vitality, confidence, and public recognition. This is an excellent line for career advancement and personal visibility.

The Moon Ascendant line enhances emotional sensitivity, intuition, and connection to home and family. This line is favorable for nurturing activities, real estate, hospitality, and any work involving caring for others.

The Venus Midheaven line brings harmony, beauty, and artistic success to the career and public reputation. This line is excellent for creative professions, relationship counseling, luxury goods, and any work involving aesthetics or diplomacy.

The Jupiter Midheaven line represents expansion, opportunity, and wisdom in career matters. This line is highly favorable for teaching, publishing, international business, law, and higher education. Success comes through knowledge and ethical practices.

The Mars Descendant line emphasizes action, competition, and assertiveness in partnerships and relationships. This line can bring dynamic energy but may also increase conflicts. Good for competitive sports, military, and leadership roles.

The Mercury IC line influences the home environment with communication, learning, and mental activity. This line is favorable for home-based businesses, writing, teaching, and any work involving information or communication from your private base.

The Saturn Ascendant line brings discipline, responsibility, and serious focus to personal identity and life direction. This line can create challenges but also builds lasting achievements through hard work and perseverance.

200.description: Complete planetary line meanings and interpretation guide

AC.meaning: Solar energy rises on the eastern horizon, enhancing personal magnetism, leadership qualities, and self-confidence. This line brings vitality, recognition, and the ability to shine in public. Excellent for careers requiring visibility and authority.

MC.meaning: The Sun culminates at the highest point in the sky, bringing maximum recognition, career success, and public honor. This is one of the most powerful lines for professional achievement and social status.

DS.meaning: Solar energy sets in the west, emphasizing partnerships, relationships, and collaborative ventures. This line brings leadership through others and success in joint endeavors.

IC.meaning: The Sun at the lowest point brings focus to home, family roots, and private foundations. This line enhances domestic life, real estate matters, and connection to ancestry.

AC.meaning: Lunar energy rises, enhancing emotional sensitivity, intuition, and psychic receptivity. This line strengthens connection to the public, women, and nurturing activities. Excellent for hospitality, healthcare, and caring professions.

MC.meaning: The Moon at the Midheaven brings public recognition through nurturing, caring, or domestic matters. Career success in fields involving women, children, food, housing, or emotional healing.

DS.meaning: Emotional focus on partnerships and close relationships. This line enhances empathy in one-on-one connections and success in counseling or therapeutic relationships.

IC.meaning: Deep emotional connection to home and roots. This line strengthens family bonds, creates a nurturing domestic environment, and enhances connection to ancestral wisdom.

AC.meaning: Venusian energy rises, enhancing personal charm, attractiveness, and artistic abilities. This line brings beauty, harmony, and success in creative or luxury fields.

MC.meaning: Venus culminates at the career point, bringing success in beauty, arts, luxury goods, or relationship-focused professions. Public recognition for aesthetic talents.

DS.meaning: Focus on beautiful, harmonious partnerships and collaborative artistic ventures. This line attracts loving relationships and creative partnerships.

IC.meaning: Beautiful, harmonious home environment with focus on aesthetics, comfort, and luxury. This line enhances domestic beauty and may indicate profitable real estate.

AC.meaning: Expansive energy rises, bringing optimism, wisdom, and opportunities for growth. This line enhances teaching ability, international connections, and philosophical pursuits.

MC.meaning: Jupiter at the Midheaven brings the most expansive career opportunities, wisdom-based success, and recognition for teaching or philosophical work. Excellent for higher education, law, or international business.

DS.meaning: Expansive partnerships and international relationships. This line brings growth through others, beneficial business partnerships, and cross-cultural connections.

IC.meaning: Expansive home environment with emphasis on learning, culture, and possibly multiple residences. This line can bring prosperity through real estate or family wisdom.

AC.meaning: Dynamic martial energy rises, enhancing courage, assertiveness, and competitive drive. This line brings leadership through action and success in physical or competitive fields.

MC.meaning: Mars at the career point brings success through action, competition, and leadership. Excellent for military, sports, engineering, or any field requiring decisive action.

DS.meaning: Dynamic energy in partnerships, potentially bringing both passion and conflict. This line can create competitive or challenging relationships that stimulate growth.

IC.meaning: Active, energetic home environment with potential for renovation, construction, or conflict. This line can bring real estate opportunities but may also increase domestic activity.

AC.meaning: Disciplined saturnian energy rises, bringing structure, responsibility, and long-term achievement. This line develops maturity and creates lasting success through persistence.

MC.meaning: Saturn at the Midheaven creates the most structured and enduring career success. Achievement comes through discipline, authority, and long-term commitment. Excellent for traditional professions.

DS.meaning: Serious, committed partnerships with emphasis on loyalty and responsibility. This line can create age differences or traditional relationship structures.

IC.meaning: Structured, disciplined home environment with emphasis on tradition and security. This line creates solid foundations but may feel restrictive or demanding.

line_types.AC: Ascendant - Where the planet rises on the eastern horizon. Affects personal identity, appearance, and how you present yourself to the world.
line_types.MC: Midheaven - Where the planet culminates at the highest point. Influences career, reputation, public recognition, and life direction.
line_types.DS: Descendant - Where the planet sets on the western horizon. Governs partnerships, relationships, and how you interact with others.
line_types.IC: Imum Coeli - Where the planet reaches its lowest point. Rules home, family, roots, and private foundation.

strength_levels.very_strong: Lines within 100km have maximum effect. Life themes are prominently activated.
strength_levels.strong: Lines within 100-200km have significant effect. Notable influence on life areas.
strength_levels.moderate: Lines within 200-300km have moderate effect. Subtle but meaningful influence.
strength_levels.weak: Lines beyond 300km have minimal effect. Background influence only.

combination_effects.multiple_lines: When multiple lines are nearby, effects blend and amplify. Look for synergistic themes.
combination_effects.conflicting_energies: Opposing planetary energies (e.g., Saturn-Jupiter) create dynamic tension and growth opportunities.
combination_effects.harmonic_combinations: Compatible planets (e.g., Sun-Jupiter, Venus-Moon) create flowing, beneficial energy.
combination_effects.power_zones: Line intersections within 50km create powerful energy vortexes with combined planetary themes.

practical_application.relocation_timing: Consider current planetary transits when moving to a new astrocartography line.
practical_application.career_planning: MC lines are most powerful for career advancement and professional recognition.
practical_application.relationship_focus: DS lines are optimal for finding partners and improving existing relationships.
practical_application.personal_development: AC lines enhance personal growth and self-expression abilities.
practical_application.home_establishment: IC lines are ideal for creating a strong foundation and establishing roots.

4. **Benefic Balance Score (15%)** - Balance of benefic vs malefic planetary influences

- Scores normalized to 0-100 scale with ratings: excellent (75+), very_good (60+), good (45+), moderate (30+), weak (15+), minimal (<15)

**Comparison options:**
- Compare 2-10 locations (minimum 2, maximum 10)
- Focus on specific life areas or compare all 13 areas
- Get detailed breakdown of planetary influences
- Rankings both overall and per life area

**Response includes:**

- comparison_matrix: Life areas x locations with scores and ranks

- best_overall: Highest scoring location
- recommendations: Best for each area, balanced choice, specialized options

post.description:
üè† **Relocated Natal Chart** - Shows how your birth chart changes in a new location

**Perfect for:**
- üåç Planning international moves or relocations
- üè° Choosing the best city for career, relationships, or personal growth
- ‚úàÔ∏è Understanding how travel destinations affect your energy
- üéØ Astrocartography validation (checking angular planets at specific locations)
- üìö Educational purposes - learning relocation astrology principles

**What you get:**
- **Location comparison** - Birth location vs. relocated location details
- **Angle shifts** - How Ascendant and Midheaven change (degrees of shift)
- **House cusps** - All 12 house cusps for both natal and relocated charts
- **Planetary positions** - Which planets changed houses, which stayed the same
- **Angular planets** - Planets within 10 degrees of Ascendant, MC, Descendant, IC in relocated chart
- **House changes** - Complete list of planets that moved to different houses
- **Key factors** - Interpretation highlights for the most significant changes

**Key concept:**
Relocation charts use the SAME birth moment (UTC) but DIFFERENT geographic coordinates.
Planetary positions remain identical - only the angles (ASC/MC/DS/IC) and house cusps change.
This shows how location affects the *expression* of your natal energies, not the energies themselves.

**Interpretation guide:**
- **Angular planets** (near ASC/MC/DS/IC) become more prominent and powerful
- **House changes** shift the life area focus of planetary energies
- **Ascendant shift > 10 degrees** = noticeable change in self-expression and identity
- **Midheaven shift > 10 degrees** = significant impact on career and public life

**Response time:** ~200-500ms | **Accuracy:** Professional grade Swiss Ephemeris

post.description:
‚ö° **Find Power Zones** - Discover concentrated astrological influence locations

**Perfect for:**
- üéØ Finding locations with combined planetary energies
- üíº Career success zones (Sun-Jupiter, Sun-Mars intersections)
- ‚ù§Ô∏è Love and harmony zones (Venus-Jupiter, Moon-Venus intersections)
- üí∞ Wealth and prosperity zones (Jupiter-Pluto, Venus-Jupiter intersections)
- üåü Personal growth hotspots

**What are Power Zones?**
Power zones occur where two or more planetary lines intersect, creating concentrated
astrological influence. Think of them as energetic "hotspots" where multiple planetary
themes combine and amplify.

**Scoring Algorithm:**
- Planet weights: Sun/Moon (1.0), Jupiter (0.9), Venus (0.85), Mars (0.8)
- Line weights: AC/MC (1.0), DS (0.8), IC (0.75)
- Tightness factor: Based on intersection precision (100km orb)
- Synergy bonuses: Benefic combos get 1.2-1.3x multiplier

**Search Options:**
- **min_strength** (0-1): Minimum strength threshold (default: 0.25)
- **max_zones** (1-100): Maximum number of zones to return (default: 20)
- **max_distance_km** (50-500): Search radius for nearby cities (default: 100)
- **preferred_combinations**: Filter for specific planet pairs, e.g. [["Sun", "Jupiter"]]
- **exclude_challenging**: Skip Mars-Saturn, Mars-Pluto combinations (default: false)
- **life_areas**: Filter by category: career, love, finance, spirituality, etc.

**Life Area Categories (45 planet pairs):**
- **career** (7): Sun-Mars, Sun-Jupiter, Sun-Saturn, Sun-Uranus, Mars-Jupiter, Mars-Saturn, Jupiter-Saturn
- **love** (6): Moon-Venus, Mars-Venus, Jupiter-Venus, Saturn-Venus, Uranus-Venus, Neptune-Venus
- **power** (8): Sun-Pluto, Moon-Uranus, Moon-Pluto, Mercury-Pluto, Mars-Uranus, Mars-Pluto, Saturn-Uranus, Pluto-Saturn
- **spirituality** (6): Sun-Neptune, Mars-Neptune, Jupiter-Neptune, Moon-Neptune, Saturn-Neptune, Neptune-Uranus
- **communication** (5): Sun-Mercury, Moon-Mercury, Mercury-Venus, Mars-Mercury, Mercury-Uranus
- **learning** (2): Jupiter-Mercury, Mercury-Saturn
- **wealth** (2): Jupiter-Uranus, Jupiter-Pluto
- **creativity** (2): Sun-Venus, Mercury-Neptune
- **home** (3): Mars-Moon, Jupiter-Moon, Moon-Saturn
- **identity** (1): Moon-Sun
- **Pluto-Venus** ‚Üí love, **Pluto-Uranus** ‚Üí power, **Neptune-Pluto** ‚Üí spirituality

**Response time:** ~800ms | **Data:** Intersections, strengths, nearby cities

**Perfect for:**

**What you get:**

- **Strength Ratings** - Based on planetary nature, angles involved, and orb tightness
- **Interpretations** - Meaning of each paran combination
- **Top 5 Strongest** - Most powerful parans for quick reference

**How parans work:**
- Standard astrocartography = vertical longitude lines (one planet on one angle)
- Parans = horizontal latitude bands (two planets on angles simultaneously)
- When Planet1 is on MC/IC AND Planet2 is on MC/IC at the same moment

**Options:**
- `primary_planet` - Main planet (default: Sun)
- `secondary_planets` - List of planets to pair with primary (default: Venus, Jupiter, Mars)
- `paran_types` - Filter by angle combinations: MC/MC, MC/IC, IC/MC, IC/IC

**Response time:** ~200ms | **Accuracy:** Swiss Ephemeris precision

Social connections flourish this week, especially mid-week when Venus harmonizes with Mercury. Your wit and charm attract interesting people. However, be mindful of scattered energy preventing deep connections.

```javascript
sendEmail({body: horoscope.text});

// SMS notification
const preview = await getHoroscope({format: 'short'});
sendSMS(preview.text);
```

post.description:
üìÑ **Generate Daily Horoscope PDF** - Beautiful, downloadable horoscope documents

**Perfect for:**
- üì± Mobile app horoscope downloads
- üìß Email attachment horoscopes
- üñ®Ô∏è Print-ready daily guidance
- üè¢ White-label B2B integrations

---

## Two Modes of Operation

1. **‚òÄÔ∏è Sun-Sign Mode**: Provide `sign` (3-letter code: "Ari", "Leo", "Sco")
   for general daily horoscopes suitable for mass distribution.

2. **üéÇ Personalized Mode**: Provide `subject` with full birth data for
   precise transit-based horoscopes with individual planetary influences.

---

## Toggleable Sections (`sections`)

| Section | Default | Description |
|---------|---------|-------------|
| `general_overview` | `true` | Overall daily theme and energy rating (1-5 stars) |
| `love_relationships` | `true` | Romance and relationship guidance |
| `career_finance` | `true` | Career moves and financial outlook |
| `health_wellness` | `true` | Physical and mental wellbeing tips |
| `lucky_elements` | `true` | Colors, numbers, stones, directions, best hours |
| `daily_affirmation` | `true` | Inspirational daily affirmation quote |
| `planetary_influences` | `true` | Active transits with exact times and direction |
| `max_planetary_influences` | `5` | Number of transits to show (1-10) |
| `moon_phase` | `true` | Current lunar phase and its meaning |
| `compatibility_tip` | `false` | Compatibility tip of the day |
| `tarot_card` | `false` | Daily tarot card pull (requires tarot service) |

**Note:** At least ONE section must be enabled.

---

## PDF Options (`pdf_options`)

### Page Settings (`page_settings`)
| Field | Type | Default | Description |
|-------|------|---------|-------------|
| `page_size` | enum | `"A4"` | A4, Letter, Legal, A3, A5 |
| `orientation` | enum | `"portrait"` | portrait, landscape |
| `margins` | object | 25.4mm | `{top, bottom, left, right}` in mm |

### Header/Footer (`header_footer`)
| Field | Type | Default | Description |
|-------|------|---------|-------------|
| `show_header` | bool | `true` | Show header on pages |
| `show_footer` | bool | `true` | Show footer on pages |
| `header_text` | string | null | Custom text with placeholders: `{title}`, `{subject_name}`, `{date}` |
| `footer_text` | string | null | Custom text with placeholders: `{page}`, `{total_pages}`, `{date}` |
| `page_numbers` | bool | `true` | Show page numbers |
| `page_number_position` | enum | `"center"` | left, center, right, none |
| `first_page_header` | bool | `false` | Show header on first page |
| `first_page_footer` | bool | `true` | Show footer on first page |

### Style (`style`)
| Field | Type | Default | Description |
|-------|------|---------|-------------|
| `theme` | enum | `"light"` | light, dark, minimal, luxury, cosmic |
| `accent_color` | string | null | Hex color for headings (#RRGGBB) |
| `secondary_color` | string | null | Hex color for subtle highlights |
| `font_style` | enum | `"modern"` | modern, classic, elegant, technical |
| `font_size_base` | int | `11` | Base font size (8-16 points) |
| `line_height` | float | `1.5` | Line height multiplier (1.0-2.5) |

### Branding (`branding`) - White-Label
| Field | Type | Default | Description |
|-------|------|---------|-------------|
| `logo_url` | string | null | URL to company logo (PNG/JPG/SVG) |
| `logo_position` | enum | `"left"` | left, center, right |
| `logo_max_height` | int | `40` | Max logo height in pixels (20-100) |
| `company_name` | string | null | Company name for header/footer |
| `company_website` | string | null | Company website URL |
| `company_tagline` | string | null | Company tagline/slogan |
| `primary_brand_color` | string | null | Primary brand color (hex) |
| `secondary_brand_color` | string | null | Secondary brand color (hex) |
| `footer_disclaimer` | string | null | Legal disclaimer for footer |

### Customization (`customization`) - Advanced CSS/HTML
| Field | Type | Max Size | Description |
|-------|------|----------|-------------|
| `custom_css` | string | 50KB | CSS to inject after base styles |
| `custom_header_html` | string | 5KB | Replace default header HTML |
| `custom_footer_html` | string | 5KB | Replace default footer HTML |
| `custom_cover_html` | string | 10KB | Replace entire cover page |
| `inject_before_content` | string | 5KB | HTML before main content |
| `inject_after_content` | string | 5KB | HTML after main content |

**HTML Placeholders:** `{{subject_name}}`, `{{birth_date}}`, `{{report_title}}`,
`{{generation_date}}`, `{{company_name}}`, `{{website}}`, `{{tagline}}`

### Other Options
| Field | Type | Default | Description |
|-------|------|---------|-------------|
| `language` | enum | `"en"` | en, ru, fr, de, es, it, pt, zh, hi, uk, ar |
| `include_cover_page` | bool | `true` | Include cover page with title |
| `include_table_of_contents` | bool | `false` | Include table of contents |
| `watermark_text` | string | null | Watermark text (DRAFT, SAMPLE, etc.) |

---

## Response

- **Content-Type:** `application/pdf`
- **Filename format:** `daily_horoscope_{sign}_{date}.pdf` or `daily_horoscope_{name}_{date}.pdf`
- **Typical size:** 50-200KB depending on sections and images

---

## Examples

See the **Examples** dropdown in the request body schema for:
1. Minimal - Quick Start
2. Standard - Recommended Default
3. Full Customization - All Options
4. White-Label - B2B Branding
5. Custom CSS - Advanced Styling
6. Personalized - Transit Analysis
7. Multilingual - Russian Language
8. Compact - Essential Sections Only

01_minimal.description: **Simplest possible request** - just sign and date. All sections enabled by default, light theme, English. Perfect for testing or basic integration.

02_standard.description: **Production-ready default configuration** with all core sections. Light theme, A4 format, English. Use this as your baseline for most horoscope PDFs.

03_full_customization.description: **Complete configuration showing ALL available options.** Dark theme, cosmic styling, custom accent colors, watermark, Letter size for US printing. Use as reference for all possible settings.

04_white_label_branding.description: **Professional white-label PDF for business customers.** Complete branding: logo, company name, tagline, custom colors, footer disclaimer. Ideal for horoscope apps, astrology portals, and digital publishers reselling horoscope content.

branding.footer_disclaimer: For entertainment purposes only. Not intended as professional advice.

05_custom_css.description: **Advanced customization with inline CSS injection.** Override default styles for headers, sections, colors, and typography. For power users who need pixel-perfect control. CSS is injected after base styles with highest priority.

customization.inject_before_content: Premium Horoscope Service
customization.inject_after_content:
Thank you for choosing our premium horoscope service.

Visit cosmicinsights.com for more personalized readings.

06_personalized_birth_data.description: **Full personalized horoscope using birth data.** Calculates precise transits to natal positions. More accurate planetary influences specific to the individual. Includes subject name on cover page.

07_multilingual_russian.description: **Russian language horoscope PDF.** Demonstrates multilingual support. Available languages: en, ru, fr, de, es, it, pt, zh, hi, uk, ar. All content, labels, and interpretations are translated.

08_minimal_sections.description: **Minimal PDF with only essential sections.** Compact 1-2 page output for quick daily guidance. Perfect for email newsletters or mobile widgets. At least one section must be enabled.

**Perfect for:**
- Understanding card combinations and energy flow
- Identifying strengths and weaknesses in spreads

**How it works:**
- **Same Element**: Cards greatly strengthen each other (2.0x)
- **Friendly Elements**: Fire+Air, Water+Earth support each other (1.5x)
- **Neutral Elements**: Fire+Earth, Air+Water balance (1.0x)
- **Opposing Elements**: Fire+Water, Air+Earth weaken each other (0.5x)

**For 3-card groups:**
- Center card is modified by flanking cards
- Average of left and right influences
- Provides combined strength and quality

**Analysis includes:**
- Individual dignity calculations for each card
- Overall elemental balance across the spread
- Strongest and weakest positions
- Dominant elemental influence
- Practical interpretation guidance

**Elemental correspondences:**
- **Fire** (Wands): Action, passion, creativity, spiritual energy
- **Water** (Cups): Emotions, intuition, relationships, healing
- **Air** (Swords): Thought, communication, conflict, clarity
- **Earth** (Pentacles): Material matters, health, practical concerns

- Planning important tarot sessions

**Astrological factors considered:**
- **Moon Phase**: New moon for beginnings, full moon for revelations
- **Planetary Hours**: Each hour ruled by different planet
- **Void of Course Moon**: Avoided for important readings
- **Day of Week**: Each day has planetary ruler
- **Personal Birth Data**: Transits to natal chart

**Question type optimization:**
- **Love**: Venus hours, Friday/Sunday, waxing moon
- **Career**: Sun/Mars hours, Sunday/Tuesday, full moon
- **Finance**: Jupiter/Venus hours, Thursday/Friday
- **Spiritual**: Moon/Neptune hours, Monday/Wednesday
- **Health**: Sun/Mars hours, Sunday/Tuesday

**Planetary hour system:**
- Each day divided into 24 planetary hours
- Day hours start at sunrise
- Night hours start at sunset
- Sequence: Saturn, Jupiter, Mars, Sun, Venus, Mercury, Moon

**Quality scoring (0-100):**
- **90-100**: Perfect alignment, ideal timing
- **80-89**: Excellent timing, highly favorable
- **70-79**: Good timing, generally positive
- **60-69**: Adequate timing, some mixed influences
- **Below 60**: Challenging timing, consider alternatives

**Response includes:**
- Ranked list of optimal time slots
- Quality score for each time
- Detailed factors affecting timing
- Explanations for each astrological influence

**Understanding Bindus:**
- Each planet gets points (bindus) based on positions from 8 reference points
- 4+ bindus: Favorable sign for the planet
- 5-6 bindus: Good results when planet transits this sign
- 7-8 bindus: Excellent results
- 0-2 bindus: Challenging sign for the planet

**Sarvashtakvarga (House Strength):**
- Combines all 7 planets' bindus for each house
- 25+ bindus: Strong house, good for related matters
- 30+ bindus: Excellent house, highly favorable
- Below 20: Weak house, may need remedies

**Shadbala Analysis** - Six-fold planetary strength system

**Perfect for:**
- Determining which planets are truly strong/weak
- Understanding why predictions may/may not manifest

**What you get:**
- **Six Bala Components** for each planet with breakdowns
- **Total Strength** in Virupas and Rupas
- **Percentage** of required strength
- **Ranking** of all 7 planets by strength

**The Six Balas (Strengths):**
1. **Sthana Bala** (Positional) - Dignity, exaltation, own sign
2. **Dig Bala** (Directional) - Planets gain strength in certain houses
3. **Kala Bala** (Temporal) - Day/night, lunar phase, season
4. **Chesta Bala** (Motional) - Speed, retrograde status
5. **Naisargika Bala** (Natural) - Inherent planetary power
6. **Drik Bala** (Aspectual) - Aspects from other planets

**Strength Interpretation:**
- **100%+** of required: Planet gives full results
- **75-99%**: Moderate results, may need support
- **50-74%**: Weak results, remedies recommended
- **Below 50%**: Very weak, strong remedies needed

**Required Strength (in Rupas):**
- Sun: 6.5 | Moon: 6.0 | Mars: 5.0 | Mercury: 7.0
- Jupiter: 6.5 | Venus: 5.5 | Saturn: 5.0

**Response time:** ~200ms | **Accuracy:** Traditional Parasara method

- **Chara Karakas** - Variable planet significators (optional)
- **Atmakaraka** - Soul significator planet details

**How Chara Dasha Works:**
- Based on signs (rashis), not planets
- Duration determined by lord's distance from sign
- **Odd signs** (Ari, Gem, Leo, Lib, Sag, Aqu): Forward progression
- **Even signs** (Tau, Can, Vir, Sco, Cap, Pis): Backward progression

**Chara Karakas (7 Variable Significators):**
1. **Atmakaraka (AK)** - Soul, self, king of chart
2. **Amatyakaraka (AmK)** - Career, profession
3. **Bhratrikaraka (BK)** - Siblings, courage
4. **Matrikaraka (MK)** - Mother, property
5. **Pitrikaraka (PiK)** - Father, children
6. **Gnatikaraka (GK)** - Enemies, diseases
7. **Darakaraka (DK)** - Spouse, marriage

**Note:** Jaimini is a complementary system to Parashari.
Many astrologers use both for comprehensive analysis.

**Response time:** ~200ms | **Accuracy:** Traditional Jaimini method

post.description:
**KP System (Krishnamurti Paddhati)** - Sub-lord based predictive astrology

**Perfect for:**
- Precise timing of events
- Yes/No question (Prashna) analysis
- Career and marriage predictions
- KP astrology practitioners

**What you get:**
- **Planet Positions** with Star Lord and Sub-Lord
- **Cusp Details** with Star Lord and Sub-Lord for each house
- **Significators** for each house (who gives results)
- **Ruling Planets** for timing verification

**Key KP Concepts:**
- **Star Lord (Nakshatra Lord)**: Determines the source of results
- **Sub-Lord**: Final deciding factor - can grant or deny results
- **Significators**: Planets that signify (give results for) a house
- **Ruling Planets**: Used to verify timing of predictions

**KP Unique Features:**
- Uses **Krishnamurti Ayanamsa** (fixed, not Lahiri)
- **Placidus House System** (unlike typical Vedic equal houses)
- **249 Sub-divisions** of the zodiac for precision
- Sub-lord determines final outcome

**Significator Strength (strongest to weakest):**
1. Occupant in star of occupant of house
2. Occupant of the house
3. Planet in star of house lord
4. House lord (cusp lord)
5. Planets aspecting the cusp

**Prediction Principle:**
- If Sub-lord signifies favorable houses: Event will happen
- If Sub-lord signifies unfavorable houses: Event denied
- The sub-lord is the final judge in KP System

**Response time:** ~200ms | **Accuracy:** Traditional KP method

- **Varshaphal Chart** - Solar return chart with planetary positions

**Key Varshaphal Concepts:**

**Year Lord (Varsheshwar):**
- Calculated from birth weekday + age
- Governs the year's main themes
- Sun: Leadership, authority, father
- Moon: Mind, emotions, mother, travel
- Mars: Energy, courage, property, conflicts
- Mercury: Intelligence, communication, skills
- Jupiter: Wisdom, children, fortune, spirituality
- Venus: Romance, luxury, marriage, arts
- Saturn: Hard work, delays, discipline

**Muntha (Progressed Point):**
- Starts at Ascendant, moves 1 sign/year
- Muntha's house indicates year's focus
- Muntha lord's strength affects results
- Best in 1, 4, 5, 7, 9, 10, 11 houses

**Panchadhikari (5 Key Rulers):**
1. Varsheshwar (Year Lord)
2. Muntheshwar (Muntha Lord)
3. Lagneshwar (Ascendant Lord)
4. Janmeshwar (Moon's nakshatra lord)
5. Dineshwar (Solar return day lord)

**Sahams (Arabic Parts):**
- Punya Saham - Overall fortune
- Karma Saham - Career matters
- Vivaha Saham - Marriage/partnerships
- Vidya Saham - Education/learning
- Santana Saham - Children

post.description:
üîÆ **Vedic Birth Chart Generator** - Traditional Jyotish chart in SVG format

**Perfect for:**
- üáÆüá≥ Vedic astrology consultations and readings
- üì± Mobile apps and websites displaying Jyotish charts
- üñ®Ô∏è High-quality printable birth charts
- üìä Educational materials and tutorials
- üé® Custom chart designs with themes and languages

**What you get:**
- **Two authentic Indian styles**: North Indian (Diamond) or South Indian (Square)
- **Sidereal zodiac calculations**: Using accurate ayanamsa systems (Lahiri, KP, Raman)
- **9 Vedic planets**: Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, Rahu, Ketu
- **Dignity markers**: ‚Üë (exalted), ‚Üì (debilitated), ‚óâ (own sign), ‚óÜ (moolatrikona)
- **Retrograde indicators**: (R) suffix for retrograde planets
- **Multilingual labels**: English, Sanskrit (romanized), or Devanagari script
- **Professional themes**: Traditional beige/brown, Dark mode, or Modern light

**Chart Styles:**

**North Indian (Diamond)**:
- Diamond-shaped chart with 12 triangular houses
- Houses are fixed, signs rotate based on Ascendant
- Popular in North India and Nepal
- Ascendant always at top position

**South Indian (Square)**:
- 4x4 grid layout with 12 outer cells
- Signs are fixed (Aries always top-left)
- Houses rotate based on Ascendant
- Diagonal line marks the Ascendant (Lagna)
- Popular in South India and Sri Lanka

**Ayanamsa Systems:**
- **Lahiri** (default): Indian Government standard, most widely used
- **Krishnamurti**: For KP (Krishnamurti Paddhati) astrology
- **Raman**: B.V. Raman's system, popular in South India

**Visual Features:**
- Scalable vector graphics (SVG) - perfect for any size
- Clean, readable design optimized for consultation
- Color-coded planets for easy identification
- Collision avoidance for multiple planets in same house/sign
- Traditional symbols and authentic layout
- Print-ready quality at any resolution

**Response time:** ~300ms | **Format:** SVG (scalable vector graphics)

post.description:
üé® **Vedic Chart Multi-Format Renderer** - Export charts as PNG, JPG, WebP, or PDF

**Perfect for:**
- üìß Email attachments and newsletters
- üì± Mobile app chart displays
- üåê Website integration (PNG/WebP)
- üñ®Ô∏è Professional printing (PDF)
- üì≤ Social media sharing (JPG)
- üíº Client consultation materials

**What you get:**
- **Multiple formats**: PNG, JPG/JPEG, WebP, PDF
- **Customizable dimensions**: 400-4000 pixels (width/height)
- **All chart features**: Same as SVG endpoint with full theme/style support
- **Optimized output**: Format-specific compression and quality

**Format Guide:**

**PNG** (Portable Network Graphics):
- Best for: Web display, email, presentations
- Features: Lossless compression, transparency support
- File size: Medium
- Use when: You need crisp charts with no quality loss

**JPG/JPEG** (Joint Photographic Experts Group):
- Best for: Social media, compressed file sharing
- Features: Lossy compression, smaller file sizes
- File size: Small
- Use when: File size is important (Instagram, Facebook, WhatsApp)

**WebP** (Modern Web Format):
- Best for: Modern websites and web apps
- Features: Superior compression (30% smaller than PNG)
- File size: Smallest
- Use when: Building modern web applications (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)

**PDF** (Portable Document Format):
- Best for: Professional printing, archival
- Features: Vector-based, scalable, print-ready
- File size: Small to medium
- Use when: Printing consultation charts or creating downloadable reports

**Size Recommendations:**
- **Web display**: 800x800 (standard), 1200x1200 (HD/Retina)
- **Social media**: 1080x1080 (Instagram), 1200x630 (Facebook/Twitter)
- **Email**: 600x600 to 800x800
- **Print**: 2000x2000 or higher (PDF recommended)

**Technical Details:**
- SVG is generated first, then converted to requested format
- PNG/JPG/WebP: Rendered at specified dimensions with high quality
- PDF: Vector-based output preserves scalability
- All formats support full theme and language customization

**Response time:** ~500ms (SVG generation + format conversion) | **Content-Type:** Varies by format

post.description:
üíï **Palm Compatibility Analysis**

Compares two palm readings to determine compatibility
across multiple dimensions.

**Input:**
- Two palm images (URL or base64)
- Language preference (en)
- Optional: return visualizations

**Compatibility Dimensions:**

1. **Element Compatibility**
   - Compares hand elements (Water/Fire/Earth/Air)
   - Based on traditional element interaction:
     - Fire + Air = Excellent synergy
     - Water + Earth = Nurturing stability
     - Fire + Water = Challenging dynamics
     - Same elements = Strong understanding

2. **Emotional Compatibility** (Heart Lines)
   - Compares heart line depth and quality
   - Similar depths indicate emotional alignment

3. **Intellectual Compatibility** (Head Lines)
   - Compares head line characteristics
   - Similar qualities suggest mental harmony

4. **Vitality Compatibility** (Life Lines)
   - Compares life line strength
   - Similar energy levels support partnership

5. **Destiny Compatibility** (Fate Lines)
   - Compares fate line presence and quality
   - Aligned destinies enhance long-term compatibility

**Output:**
- Overall compatibility score (0-1)
- Detailed breakdown by dimension
- Annotated images (optional)
- Interpretation text

Supports three ways to specify the horoscope target:
1. By zodiac sign only (sign field)
2. By specific date (date field)
3. By full subject birth data (subject field) - personalized horoscope

The sections field controls which content sections to include.
The pdf_options field controls all PDF styling and layout.

FertilityAnalysisRequest.title: FertilityAnalysisRequest
FertilityAnalysisRequest.description:
Request schema for specialized pregnancy/fertility analysis.

Customer priority feature. Analyzes fertility indicators including:
- Sign fertility (Cancer most fruitful, Virgo most barren)
- Part of Children (ASC + Saturn - Jupiter)
- Part of Pregnancy (ASC + L5 - Moon)
- 5th house analysis (pregnancy/children house)

extended_lunar_sequence.description: Enable extended lunar sequence analysis (45¬∞ lookahead, 10-22 aspects). Shows full sequence of future events with position of quesited aspect. Set False for traditional sign-boundary-only analysis.

max_lookahead_degrees.description: Maximum degrees ahead for lunar sequence calculation. Default 45¬∞ produces 10-22 aspects. Only used when extended_lunar_sequence=True.

HoraryAnalysisRequest.title: HoraryAnalysisRequest
HoraryAnalysisRequest.description:
Request schema for full horary analysis with judgment.

Performs complete analysis: radicality check, significator identification,
aspect perfection, reception analysis, and final judgment (yes/no/unclear).

question_time.description: The date, time, and location for aspect calculation (typically when question was understood).

max_lookahead_degrees.title: Max Lookahead Degrees
max_lookahead_degrees.description: Maximum degrees ahead to search for applying aspects. Default 45¬∞ returns 10-22 aspects. Use 90¬∞ for extended analysis.

include_separating.description: Include separating aspects in addition to applying. Default False (applying only).

planets.description: Filter to specific planets. Default None = all 7 traditional planets. Options: Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn.

include_ingresses.title: Include Ingresses
include_ingresses.description: Include sign ingresses (planet entering new sign). Default True.

include_stations.title: Include Stations
include_stations.description: Include planetary stations (R/D changes). Default True. Note: Sun/Moon excluded.

max_station_days.title: Max Station Days
max_station_days.description: Maximum days ahead to search for stations. Default 365 days.

HoraryAspectsRequest.title: HoraryAspectsRequest
HoraryAspectsRequest.description:
Request schema for horary planetary aspects calculation.

Returns all applying aspects between traditional 7 planets with degrees_to_perfection.
Essential for horary timing and event sequence analysis.

applying_aspects.description: All applying aspects between planets, sorted by degrees_to_perfection. These are future events - aspects moving toward perfection.

ingresses.description: Sign ingresses within lookahead period. Shows when planets will enter new signs. Sorted by degrees_to_ingress.

stations.title: Stations
stations.description: Planetary stations within search period. Shows upcoming R (retrograde) or D (direct) stations. Sun/Moon excluded.

Contains all applying aspects sorted by degrees_to_perfection (soonest first).

examples: Will I get the job I interviewed for?

Should I accept the business partnership offer?
When will I find my lost ring?

inject_after_content.title: Inject After Content
inject_after_content.description: HTML to inject after main content (after body sections, before footer). Useful for custom conclusions or calls-to-action. Supports placeholders.
examples: Thank you for choosing {{company_name}}. Visit {{website}} for more.

PDFCustomization.title: PDFCustomization
PDFCustomization.description:
Advanced customization for inline CSS/HTML modifications.

For power users who need precise control over PDF output.
Use with caution - invalid CSS may break rendering.

Supported placeholders in custom HTML:
- {{subject_name}} - Subject's full name
- {{birth_date}} - Subject's birth date (formatted)
- {{report_title}} - Report title
- {{generation_date}} - Date when PDF was generated
- {{company_name}} - Company name (from branding)
- {{website}} - Company website (from branding)
- {{tagline}} - Company tagline (from branding)

TransitChartRequest.title: TransitChartRequest
TransitChartRequest.description:
üÜï Unified transit chart request with backward-compatible legacy field support.

**New format (recommended):**
- `subject` - Birth data for natal chart
- `transit_time` - Either specific datetime OR date range

**Legacy format (still supported):**
- `natal_subject` - Alias for `subject`
- `transit_datetime` - Specific datetime (maps to transit_time.datetime)

transit_datetime.description: ‚ö†Ô∏è LEGACY: Use 'transit_time.datetime' instead. Specific datetime for transit calculation.

Request for Human Design transit overlay on natal bodygraph.

Analyzes how current planetary transits activate gates, form temporary
channels, and temporarily define centers in the natal chart.

datetime.description: Specific date/time for transit calculation (for SVG charts or single-point analysis).

TransitTime.title: TransitTime
TransitTime.description:
üÜï Unified transit time specification - accepts either a specific datetime OR a date range.

Use `datetime` for single-point transit calculations (SVG charts, current transits).
Use `date_range` for transit event searches over a period.

If both are provided, `datetime` takes precedence for single-point calculations,
while `date_range` is used for event searches.

preferred_pass.description: For triple returns (Venus retrograde): which pass to chart. 'first' = first direct pass, 'last_direct' = final direct pass (the 'sealing' pass, default), 'nearest' = closest to return_date. Ignored for single returns.

WeeklyHoroscopePDFRequest.title: WeeklyHoroscopePDFRequest
WeeklyHoroscopePDFRequest.description:
Request for generating a weekly horoscope PDF.

Supports three ways to specify the horoscope target:
1. By zodiac sign only (sign field)
2. By specific week start date (week_start field, normalized to Monday)
3. By full subject birth data (subject field) - personalized horoscope

The sections field controls which content sections to include.
The pdf_options field controls all PDF styling and layout.

header.title: Header
header.description: Include header with sign, week dates, and overall rating

energy_timeline.title: Energy Timeline
energy_timeline.description: Include 7-day energy timeline with visual bars showing daily ratings

max_planetary_influences.title: Max Planetary Influences
max_planetary_influences.description: Maximum number of planetary influences to display (1-15). Default is 10 for weekly.

aspect_calendar.title: Aspect Calendar
aspect_calendar.description: Include aspect calendar showing daily aspects Mon-Sun

houses_in_focus.title: Houses In Focus
